name: Explosive footage
description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

key_work.title: Blade Runner
key_work.creator_credit: Michael Deeley, Ridley Scott, Douglas Trumbull, Richard Yuricich and Shaw Brothers
key_work.headline_credit: Hong Kong, United Kingdom and United States of America, 1982
key_work.brief_description: In the smog-choked dystopian Los Angeles of 2019, blade runner Rick Deckard is called out of retirement to terminate a quartet of replicants who have escaped to Earth seeking their creator for a way to extend their short life spans.

constellations_primary.name: Explosive footage
constellations_primary.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Expansive light in science fiction and fantasy
constellations_other.description: Visual artists have identified the importance of light in revealing the expansiveness of our universe. Explore how artists’ perception of light has been adapted and referenced in science fiction and fantasy on screen.

constellations_other.name: Little, big worlds
constellations_other.description: Wes Anderson's stop-motion animation film draws on tried-and-true techniques that, despite the rise of computer-generated imagery, still inspire filmmakers and game-makers.

constellations_other.name: Alternate histories and futures
constellations_other.description: Sue Ford's Egami reimagines contemporary life through a feminist and colonial lens.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

constellations_other.name: Arcades and AI
constellations_other.description: Using the godfather of computing, Alan Turing, as a starting point, this Constellation traces the evolution of AI representation on-screen and the way female androids, robots and holograms have been hyper sexualised.

constellations_other.name: Explosive footage
constellations_other.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

end.title: Isle of Dogs
end.creator_credit: Eli Bush, Wes Anderson, Jeremy Dawson, Scott Rudin, Steven M. Rales and Scott Rudin Productions
end.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2018

video_links.name: ISLE OF DOGS | Official Trailer | FOX Searchlight

end.brief_description: In the future, an outbreak of canine flu leads the mayor of a Japanese city to banish all dogs to an island that’s a garbage dump. The outcasts must soon embark on an epic journey when a 12-year-old boy arrives on the island to find his beloved pet.

constellations_primary.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_primary.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

constellations_other.name: Explosive footage
constellations_other.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

links.description: Roman Coppola, who directed ‘Gangster Trippin”, went on to work alongside his cousin Jason Schwartzman, and director Wes Anderson, as scriptwriters on a number of Anderson’s projects, including Isle of Dogs.

constellations_other.name: Explosive footage
constellations_other.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

end.title: Zabriskie Point
end.brief_description: An epic portrait of late Sixties America, as seen through the portrayal of two of its children: anthropology student Daria (who’s helping a property developer build a village in the Los Angeles desert) and dropout Mark (who’s wanted by the authorities for allegedly killing a policeman during a student riot)…

constellations_other.name: Explosive footage
constellations_other.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

links.description: The slow-motion exploding furniture at the end of Zabriskie Point were a clear inspiration for the music video of Fatboy Slim’s 90s hit ‘Gangster Trippin”.

start.title: Blade Runner
start.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Douglas Trumbull, Richard Yuricich, Michael Deeley and Shaw Brothers
start.headline_credit: Hong Kong, United Kingdom and United States of America, 1982
start.brief_description: In the smog-choked dystopian Los Angeles of 2019, blade runner Rick Deckard is called out of retirement to terminate a quartet of replicants who have escaped to Earth seeking their creator for a way to extend their short life spans.

constellations_primary.name: Explosive footage
constellations_primary.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Expansive light in science fiction and fantasy
constellations_other.description: Visual artists have identified the importance of light in revealing the expansiveness of our universe. Explore how artists’ perception of light has been adapted and referenced in science fiction and fantasy on screen.

constellations_other.name: Little, big worlds
constellations_other.description: Wes Anderson's stop-motion animation film draws on tried-and-true techniques that, despite the rise of computer-generated imagery, still inspire filmmakers and game-makers.

constellations_other.name: Alternate histories and futures
constellations_other.description: Sue Ford's Egami reimagines contemporary life through a feminist and colonial lens.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

constellations_other.name: Arcades and AI
constellations_other.description: Using the godfather of computing, Alan Turing, as a starting point, this Constellation traces the evolution of AI representation on-screen and the way female androids, robots and holograms have been hyper sexualised.

end.title: Pokémon Detective Pikachu
end.creator_credit: Cale Boyter, Don McGowan, Hidenaga Katakami and Mary Parent
end.headline_credit: Japan and United States of America, 2019

video_links.name: POKÉMON Detective Pikachu - Destiny  - Warner Bros. UK

end.brief_description: In a world where people collect pocket-size monsters (Pokémon) to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent monster who seeks to be a detective.

constellations_other.name: Explosive footage
constellations_other.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

constellations_other.name: Neo-noir
constellations_other.description: Blade Runner's retro-futurist setting lends it a timeless quality, while also connecting it to the past and the future.

links.description: The neo-noir cityscape of Blade Runner was a key influence on Pokémon Detective Pikachu. To achieve this, cinematographer John Mathieson, who had previously worked with Ridley Scott, shot on 35mm film, and used as many practical effects as possible.

end.brief_description: An epic portrait of late Sixties America, as seen through the portrayal of two of its children: anthropology student Daria (who’s helping a property developer build a village in the Los Angeles desert) and dropout Mark (who’s wanted by the authorities for allegedly killing a policeman during a student riot)…

constellations_other.name: Explosive footage
constellations_other.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

links.description: The flames seen over the Los Angeles skyline were actually filmed by VFX supervisor Douglas Trumbull while working on Antonioni’s Zabriskie Point. As the fireball footage never got used, he had them in his archives ready to add to Blade Runner.

links.description: Acclaimed character actor Ken Watanabe appears in Pokémon Detective Pikachu as Lieutenant Hide Yoshida, and lends his voice to stop motion film Isle of Dogs.
